A Collection in
The Special Collections Department 10974
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections Department, University of Virginia Library

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Casey and Dudley Family Papers ca. 1923-1988
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 9,000 items.
did.abstract: This collection consists of ca. 9,000 items, ca. 1923-1988, pertaining to the Casey and Dudley families. Chiefly, there are personal, business, and legal correspondence and papers of Joseph Edward Casey, Constance Marion (Dudley) Casey, and Herman Andrew Dudley. To a lesser extent, there are correspondence and papers of the Casey children and their families, Caroline Whittier Casey, Constance Louise Casey, John Casey, Joseph Edward Casey, Jr., and Jane Dudley (Casey) Kuczynski. In addition, there are also correspondence and papers of the parents of Constance Marion (Dudley) Casey, Charles Howard Dudley and Ida Louise (Ockerblad) Dudley, and their other children and their families: Bernard Francis Dudley, Charles Milo Dudley, and Robert Whittier Dudley.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: No quotations are allowed without permission of the owner.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the Casey and Dudley Families, Accession #10974, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was deposited in the Library by John Casey of Charlottesville, Virginia, on August 22, 1990.
